reviews.text: Neat place to learn about local history.  Children enjoyed visitor center.  Hike through park is best taken early morning or on a cloudy day given how hot it can get.
One of my favorite places to go swim and snorkel with my small children.  Every single time we go there we see sea turtles!! But please remember to stay a minimum of 20ft away from them.

Great park with a pretty but rocky main beach and a ~ 1.5 mile trail through a cooled lava field to a beautiful white sand beach for swimming and surfing and stuff. We also saw an 800 pound monk seal sunning itself which was sick.
The access road is long and rugged so a low ridding car might not make it, but a regular sedan should be fine if u drive slow
Lot of shade. Easy, shallows for snorkeling. Good for wading with kids. Only outhouses. No showers. Beautiful place.

Lovely beach, and not as heavily populated makes for a quiet afternoon. It does not take long to see a turtle make it's way onto the beach to soak up the sun. Not quite as picturesque as a typical beach, and your milage may vary with swimming, but great opportunity to snorkel or relax.

This is one of the few Costcos that I know if with 2 floors. This makes it more cumbersome to get around the store, particularly if you forget to get something on the second floor once you've descended to the first. 
That aside, it has a great selection and occasional seasonal treasures.
Rotisserie chicken is tasty and cheap at 699 yen! Great place to buy steaks as well.

Very good whole sale kind of store. 
👍 Prices are cheap compared to other shops. Really competitive pricing.
👍 can find many items which is not available in shops around. 
👍 Many organic items are available.
👍 can find many American products here.

Negative points are:
👎🏽 you need to buy large quantities, which some times we may not require. 
👎🏽 for some of the cycles sold here, getting spare parts would be difficult.
Verry nice shopping centre and you can get all goods with reasonable price.
We love the food here, and fresh berries available all year round.

One of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had (ranks up there with the "Whole Foods Incident"). So my sister renewed my member card which is on a family plan. I trusted this would work and decided to stop by this Costco which is a huge trip out of the city, so everything had to go well or else it would be a wasted trip. Erring on the side of caution, I decided to ask the front desk about my member status anyway. Sure enough, I knew they would screw it up. They stared at the screen in confusion and after a few minutes of squabbling amongst each other, claimed my card was now invalid! I protested that it was on a family plan and had indeed been renewed, but they claimed I could not prove that and the issue was with "America". They continued to blame "America" until I shouted them down saying it's not a problem with a country, it's a COSTCO problem. That shut them up and they issued a temporary pass. The next day they called me back to tell me my card was indeed activated. So all this was COMPLETELY unnecessary and blaming a country is just plain unprofessional. 
Oh, and they won't let you buy one box of muffins. You are not even allowed to do so. You have to carry two heavy boxes or none at all, and I was carrying them home by hand. As a loyal customer of this place since I was in grade school, absolutely shameful, Costco.

Great sandwiches. The make their own bread. Fantastic view from the outside eating area. Had fresh fish and pastrami sandwich. Really good, big portions. The cakes are to die for. Very friendly service. A must stop for every Hawaii visit. Love coming there since years.

Whole family enjoyed it. We ordered nearly all of the breakfast offerings and everyone was happy. Even simple things like the bacon and potatoes we felt were a head above your average breakfast spot. Creative and delicious. Would definitely visit again.

The view is amazing!

My husband said the coffee is good. His omelette was mainly cheese.

I ordered ice tea and French toast with bacon. The ice tea was pretty see through. Pretty much water with a hint of flavor. French toast just wasn't good. We split one piece and didn't touch the rest. My bacon looked amazing. Flavor was lacking. Might be because it was overcooked.

Server only came back to hand us the check. Never asked how the food was. I would have been honest and asked for something else. She did ask if I was done (untouched french toast) or wanted a box. 

Maybe it was an off day.

Some of the best food for the money that you can find on the island. We were there for breakfast and had a simple eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast.  The orange juice was great as well! 
Beyond the food, the staff was great and friendly and the views were awesome. 
Parking is a little difficult and limited but don't let that deter you!

The timing was perfect. Wasn't too packed. Great service and food. Loved the iced honey mocha latte! Fresh fruit was also ripe and delicious! Great view of the ocean and farm lands. Wonderful breeze while we ate. Can't wait to go back!

It's acceptable. Probably the best Mexican food in the area. If you just need a simple meal you'll do fine here.
Salsa is kinda watery but has a good kick.
Service is fast and good.

Mexican food on the sea side was interesting. Pricing for the value was only all right. Total bill for two people came north of $70 for ingredients that came from Costco. Drinks were ok, again expensive for content. There are definitely places I would rather go for this price. 

On the whole, food was still prepared well and tasted fine.

This is a great option for Mexican food in Kona. Prices are great and the options are all tasty. Has a pretty good variety on the menu and great happy hour options. Can't say anything negative about this location or the food so I'll leave it with, give it a try! 🤙

Great place for Mexican food!!! The the chips and salsa we're good, the chips were home made, and the salsa was good. The Nachos were excellent, just the way I ordered the enchiladas were a little dry, not enough cheese inside.  Drinks were made well, but they didn't have coffee, and didn't want to make anymore just for me? What the? The service was a little slow, but very pleasant. Still ..... one of the best Mexican restaurants on the island.

We have been going here for 10 years. The food has not changed, wonderful beso calientas, jalapeno, shrimp, jack cheese wrapped in bacon and fried how can you go wrong? Margaritas are yummy and strong. The building itself is falling apart, there has been minimal if no maintenance to it. Sadly 10 years ago it was a hot place! We will still come back every year

Great people great pho!
Their sandwiches are great too.  Ba-Le makes their own French bread.
Their bahn mi sandwiches are the best in town. I prefer the lemongrass chicken bahn mi sandwich its delicious
Best bahn me I have ever eaten! The bread here is incredible!
Best food I had in long time on the big island
Slow service. Took 25 minutes for 2 sandwiches. But tasted great

This is a wonderful, small, sushi shop. You can walk in, place your order and have it within about 20 minutes, or call your order to pick up. No indoor seating, but there are nice covered tables outdoors. We had spicy ahi and the California roll, and both were fresh and delicious. If you enjoy sushi, give this place a try.

Oh wow, such fresh sushi! Best sushi in town! My favorite by far was the ninja star. Had a little kick to it! We will be back! Also the rolls are well priced, $7-9 usually. We ordered 4 rolls for the 2 of us, and probably would’ve been fine with just 2 rolls. We had some extra left for dinner. :)
Incredible value for delicious sushi. Highly recommended. Might be a wait but well worth it.

The food is good. However the place doesn’t take orders from phone calls and there is always 2 hours waiting for couple of rolls. They should just have more employees and make the experience of buying there more convenient for their customers.
We visited 2yrs ago on local recommendations and were happy then and equally as happy now!!! #Yummy
Closed! Purchased a gift certificate for a birthday and joined the online club. Came to the island only to find out its closed with private property no trespassing signs all over. A pity for sure

Great food and great service. We sat out on the Lanai and it was beautiful! The only problem for us was that the table which is the last from the from the Lanai next to the opening to the restaurant is by a board that causes the table to jump every time someone walks by the board. I almost lost a drink from that problem. Otherwise everything we had which included the Shrimp Extravaganza and the fish tacos and wonderful mango smoothie were all great!
Great food, great service and I love going there in the evenings to watch sunset and the waves crash.

Food was delicious, service was quick, attentive, friendly, and efficient! Definitely coming again, but ....

WARNING: NO DR. PEPPER!

so you may need to BYOB your 15 pack of Dr. P when you go. Their bathroom wall even has the quote from Forrest Gump "I must've drank me about fifteen Dr. Peppers" on it so when you go to wash your hands before eating you'll see it, want it, and then feel let down when they tell you they don't serve it. So come prepared! 

Everything else was wonderfully authentic to the film, but I know Forrest would've wanted Dr. Pepper at his Bubba Gump Shrimp Company establishments.
Every time we have been here, has all been a great!  Service is good and food always been great.Ri b ht on the water.

Are you kidding me? I called ahead for 12 people 5 of them being small kids. I had to wait another 45 minutes after the call ahead time to get seated and I repeat with 5 small children. Are you kidding me? Is the call ahead not done for that particular reason that I don’t have to spend an hour waiting for a table with small children? I don’t understand. The host not only is standing there giving me an issue but also making comments about how he can’t do anything. Perhaps you shouldn’t be making a call and head if you cannot accommodate. Disgusting! Very disappointed my last time here.

Excellent service that evening and the steaks were cooked to perfection. I strongly recommend people tell them to leave their seasoning off because it really ruins s a good piece of meat.  I loved that the sweet potato was not in foil so it was actually a sweet potato and not pudding.  The New York strip was amazingly tasty for the price. Our waiter was really on top of things and kept our glasses full and kept checking to see if we were satisfied. The salads were very fresh and tasty. I do recommend the wedge salad because it is excellent and a good value.

Wow Wow Wow. Had a great meal. Service was outstanding.  The waiter Michael was a step above all before.  We both had a special.  Lobster tail and Sirloin - and - Lobster tail and Crab Cakes and Shrimp skewer. A couple beers and the Awesome brownie.  Looking forward to going back and asking for the same waiter Michael!

I tried something new this visit and had the Pork Porterhouse. It was cooked perfectly, properly cooked and still juicy. It was very savory and I was very happy with my selection. The waiter, though he got our order correct and sufficiently attentive, while he was standing in front of our table seemed like we were keeping him from something more important. It was a typical Outback, so nothing to write home about with the decor. We were seating at the first booth from the lobby, so we saw quite a bit of foot traffic. In general, a nice meal with the delicious piece of pork being the best thing of the night.

Terrible experience yesterday. 3:45 in the afternoon and half the restaurant is empty! We were told to wait for 40 minutes until a waiter came on duty to wait on us🙄😡
So we left and went to Texas Roadhouse where we received amazing treatment with excellent customer service. 
We will not go back to Outback ever!!

Great experience here. Very low key mellow environment. Super friendly staff. Order at the counter and they bring your food and drinks to you. Nice outdoor seating area as well. No wait, when we went at 5 pm. Kona and Ola brewing on tap! Well priced compared to many places in the area.

Awesome pizza, calzone, garlic knots, caesar salad and cheesy bread. The kids ate EVERYTHING, and that's saying a lot, for my kids. The dough is soft and amazing. The staff were working hard and were also very helpful and courteous. Great place to eat after a long day at the beach. The outdoor patio atmosphere was laid back and relaxing.
Pretty good Hawaiian pizza. Nice sitting area outside. Workers are all friendly and helpful.

TL;DR - dang good pie and great service from a family operation. 

———

As stated below, my wife and I ate here twice, and we were very happy with the overall experience. Beyond delicious pizza (the BBQ Chicken and the Jaws were awesome!), the folks behind the counter are kind, communicative, and hard working. 

Our first night, before we ordered, we were informed that the wait would be around 1.5 hours, due to a huge order being placed a while before us. That was obviously not what we had expected, and we considered looking elsewhere to eat. However, we opted for individual slices, which came out much quicker, and were just what we needed. An individual slice is definitely entree sized - these folks aren’t playing. I appreciated their honesty and upfront message about the wait, but also that they were flexible enough to help feed us quicker! 

The second time around, after having such yummy pie the first time, we ordered almost exactly what we did previously. So much so, that when our ticket read for a different item than what we ordered, the staff recognized our previous order and got it sorted out. Again, awesome! 

So, if you are trying to find good pizza in Kona - this is it!

My husband and I visited Longboard Legends twice on our trip to the Big Island! We absolutely loved the pizza, salads and fresh ingredients. It is always nice to support local businesses and especially a family business. 
I thoroughly enjoyed the Greek Salad and being able to create my own slice of pizza. The crust is awesome and everything tastes so fresh. 
We would highly recommend this place!
